item.title: Google Photorealistic 3D Tiles & Unreal Engine
item.description: - A developer used Google Photorealistic 3D tiles API and Unreal Engine 5.1 to create an immersive experience that combines location data with dynamic responses from the ChatGPT API.

item.title: Orb Farm
item.description: - Orb Farm is a personalized aquatic ecosystem for nurturing, sculpting, and observing.

item.title: Linux tool to show progress for cp, mv, dd
item.description: - Progress is a tool that runs on Linux, FreeBSD, and macOS and displays the percentage of copied data for basic commands like cp, mv, dd, tar, gzip/gunzip, and cat.

item.title: Nyxt: The Hacker's Browser
item.description: - Nyxt is a browser with many built-in features for analyzing, navigating, and extracting information from the internet.

item.title: Cities Aren't Loud: Cars Are Loud (2021) [video]
item.description: - A video shared by the Vox YouTube channel explores how cars are the biggest source of noise pollution in cities, and that loud cars are not a necessary feature of transportation technology.

item.title: FreeBSD spends 7% of its boot time running a bubblesort on its SYSINITs
item.description: - When the FreeBSD kernel boots in Firecracker (1 CPU, 128 MB RAM), it now spends 7% of its time running a bubblesort on its SYSINITs.

item.title: Migrating from Supabase
item.description: - Val Town migrated from Supabase to Render due to problems encountered with scalability and local development issues.

item.title: Apple Restricts Employee Use of ChatGPT, Joining Other Companies Wary of Leaks
item.description: - Apple has restricted the use of ChatGPT and other AI tools for some employees.

item.title: Venture Predation
item.description: - Predatory pricing is a strategy used by firms to suppress competition.

item.title: Satellites reveal widespread decline in global lake water storage
item.description: - Satellite observations, climate models, and hydrologic models indicate that more than 50% of large natural lakes and reservoirs have experienced volume loss over the past 30 years due to both human activities and climatic factors.
